Text: Shistavanen typically stand around 6 feet tall and weigh between 140 and 190 lbs. Regardless of your position in that range, your size is Medium.

Name: Speed
Text: Your base walking speed is 30 feet.

Name: Tooth and Nail
Text: Your fangs and claws are natural weapons, which you can use to make unarmed strikes. Additionally, your unarmed strikes deal 1d6 kinetic damage.

Name: Ability Score Increase
Text: Your Charisma score increases by 2, and your Dexterity score increases by 1.

Name: Age
Text: Squibs reach adulthood at nine years of age and live an average of sixty-five years.

Name: Alignment
Text: Squibs' cheerful nature causes them to tend toward the light side, though there are exceptions.

Name: Bite
Text: Your sharp teeth are a natural weapon, which you can use to make unarmed strikes. Additionally, your unarmed strikes deal 1d4 kinetic damage.

Name: Business Savvy
Text: A common trait of all Squibs is their desire and love of haggling. Squibs believe a deal is done when both sides believe they got the better of the other. Whenever you make a Charisma (Persuasion) check involving haggling you are considered to have expertise in the Persuasion skill.

Name: Flexible Cheeks
Text: Squibs have flexible cheeks in which they can store small goods. You can store up to two items that weigh a combined total of no more than 2 lb. in your cheeks, and you have advantage on Dexterity (Sleight of Hand) checks made to conceal them.

Name: Hide
Text: Your thick hide is naturally adapted to cold climates, as described in chapter 5 of the Dungeon Master's Guide.

Name: Keen Smell
Text: You have advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell.

Name: Languages
Text: You can speak, read, and write Galactic Basic and Squibbian. The Squibbian language originated as a secret form of communication for Squibs to convey information without being understood.

Name: Sensitive Fur
Text: Squibs' fur is exceptionally sensitive to physical details. You have advantage on Intelligence (Investigation) checks that rely on touch.

Name: Size
Text: Squibs typically stand 3 to 3 and a half feet tall and weigh around 50 lbs. Regardless of your position in that range, your size is Small.

Name: Speed
Text: Your base walking speed is 25 feet.

Name: Undersized
Text: Your small stature makes it hard for you to wield bigger weapons. You can't use heavy shields. Additionally, you can't use martial weapons with the two-handed property unless it also has the light property, and if a martial weapon has the versatile property, you can only wield it in two hands.

Name: Ability Score Increase
Text: Your Strength score increases by 2, and your Dexterity score increases by 1.

Name: Age
Text: Ssi-ruuk reach adulthood in their early teens and live to between 100 and 120 years.

Name: Alignment
Text: Ssi-ruuk's cultural drive to enslave and entech others cause them to tend toward the dark side, though there are exceptions.

Name: Force-Insensitive
Text: While Ssi-ruuk can be manipulated by many force powers, they can not sense the Force. You can not use force powers or take levels in forcecasting classes.

Name: Hunter
Text: You are proficient in Survival.

Name: Keen Smell
Text: You have advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell.

Name: Languages
Text: You can speak, read, and write Galactic Basic and Ssi-ruuvi. Ssi-ruuvi is a language of musical whistles, honks and clicks, and is nigh impossible for humans and similar species to speak.

Name: Natural Empathy
Text: Ssi-ruuk have scent-tongues that let them read the emotions of individuals. You have advantage on Wisdom (Insight) checks to determine emotions against humanoids and beasts within 10 feet of you.

Name: Size
Text: Ssi-ruuk typically stand between 6 or 7 feet tall and weigh over 300 lbs. Regardless of your position in that range, your size is Medium.

Name: Speed
Text: Your base walking speed is 35 feet.

Name: Sunlight Sensitivity
Text: You have disadvantage on attack rolls and on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight when you, the target of your attack, or whatever you are trying to perceive is in direct sunlight.

Name: Thick Skin
Text: You have tough, scaly skin and prefer not to wear clothes. While you are unarmored or wearing light armor, your AC is 13 + your Dexterity modifier.

Name: Tooth and Nail
Text: Your fangs and claws are natural weapons, which you can use to make unarmed strikes. Additionally, your unarmed strikes deal 1d6 kinetic damage.

Name: Type
Text: Your creature type is both beast and humanoid.

Name: Ability Score Increase
Text: Your Intelligence score increases by 2, and your Dexterity score increases by 1.

Name: Age
Text: Sullustan reach adulthood in their late teens and live less than a century.

Name: Alignment
Text: Sullustans' outgoing and friendly nature cause them to tend toward the light side, though there are exceptions.

Name: Darkvision
Text: You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

Name: Keen Hearing
Text: You have advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing.

Name: Languages
Text: You can speak, read, and write Galactic Basic, Sullestese, and one more language of your choice. Sullestese is characterized as a robust language in business, and as such is commonly learned by professional merchants.

Name: Mercantile
Text: Whenever you make a Charisma (Persuasion) check related to conducting business, you are considered to have expertise in the Persuasion skill.

Name: Pilot
Text: You have proficiency in Piloting.

Name: Size
Text: Sullustans typically stand 4 and a half to 5 feet tall and weigh around 120 lbs. Regardless of your position in that range, your size is Medium.

Name: Speed
Text: Your base walking speed is 30 feet.

Name: Ability Score Increase
Text: Your Strength score increases by 2, and your Wisdom score increases by 1.

Name: Age
Text: Talz reach adulthood at 10 and rarely live longer than 50 years.

Name: Alignment
Text: Talz' peaceful and slow-to-anger nature cause them to tend toward the light side, though there are exceptions.

Name: Darkvision
Text: Your vision can easily cut through darkness. You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

Name: Hide
Text: You have a thick hide. While you are unarmored or wearing light armor, your AC is 12 + your Dexterity modifier. Additionally, your thick hide is naturally adapted to cold climates, as described in chapter 5 of the Dungeon Master's Guide.

Name: Languages
Text: You can speak, read, and write Talzzi. You can understand spoken and written Galactic Basic, but your vocal cords do not allow you to speak it. Talzzi is characterized by its high-pitched chirps and buzzes.

Name: Long-Limbed
Text: When you make a melee attack on your turn, your reach for it is 5 feet greater than normal.

Name: Size
Text: Talz stand between 6 and 8 feet tall and weigh around 250 lbs. Regardless of your position in that range, your size is Medium.

Name: Speed
Text: Your base walking speed is 30 feet.

Name: Ability Score Increase
Text: Your Intelligence score increases by 2, and your Dexterity score increases by 1.

Name: Age
Text: Tarasins reach adulthood at 10 and live less than 80 years.

Name: Alignment
Text: Tarasins' curious yet composed nature causes them to tend toward balanced alignments, though there are exceptions.

Name: Chameleon Skin
Text: Your scales are translucent, allowing your color-shifting skin to help you blend into your surroundings. You have proficiency in the Stealth skill. Additionally, you can attempt to hide even when you are only lightly obscured by foliage, heavy rain, falling snow, mist, and other natural phenomena.

Name: Jungle Dweller
Text: Growing up in the jungles of Cularin has left an impact. You don't treat jungle terrain as difficult terrain.

Name: Languages
Text: You can speak, read, and write Galactic Basic and Tarasinese. You can communicate non-verbally with other tarasins through use of a complex system of skin color changes.

Name: Naturalist
Text: You have proficiency in the Nature skill.

Name: Sa'tosin Sense
Text: Tarasins have short spines called sa'tosin that allow them to sense the use of the Force. You are constantly under the effects of the force power *sense force*, though the power does not require concentration for you.

Name: Size
Text: Tarasins typically stand 5 to 6 feet tall and generally weigh about 130 lbs. Regardless of your position in that range, your size is Medium.

Name: Speed
Text: Your base walking speed is 30 feet.

Name: Ability Score Increase
Text: Your Constitution score increases by 2, and your Strength score increases by 1.

Name: Age
Text: Taung reach adulthood at 13 and live to around 85, though they rarely live even half the length as they naturally can due to their deadly lifestyles as Mandalorians.

Name: Alignment
Text: The taung live by the traditions and honor-bound code of the Mandalorians, making them tend towards a lawful alignment, typically balanced or dark, though there are exceptions.

Name: Claws
Text: Your claws are natural weapons, which you can use to make unarmed strikes. Additionally, your unarmed strikes deal 1d4 kinetic damage.

Name: Force Insensitive
Text: While taung can be manipulated by the force, they cannot sense the Force. You can not use force powers or take levels in forcecasting classes.

Name: Languages
Text: You can speak, read, and write Galactic Basic and Mando'a. Mando'a is primarily a spoken language and is very expressive with simple grammar.

Name: Menacing
Text: You gain proficiency in the Intimidation skill.

Name: Relentless Endurance
Text: When you are reduced to 0 hit points but not killed outright, you can drop to 1 hit point instead. You can't use this feature again until you finish a long rest.

Name: Size
Text: Taung typically stand between 6 and 7 feet tall and weigh around 210 lbs. Regardless of your position in that range, your size is Medium.

Name: Speed
Text: Your base walking speed is 30 feet.

Name: Taung Weapon Training
Text: You gain proficiency in one vibroweapon and one blaster of your choice.

Name: Toughness
Text: Your hit point maximum increases by 1, and it increases by 1 every time you gain a level.

Name: Ability Score Increase
Text: Your Charisma score increases by 2, and two other ability scores of your choice increase by 1.

Name: Age
Text: Theelin reach adulthood in their late teens and live for about 70 years.

Name: Alignment
Text: Theelin's good-nature and positivity despite the dour state of their species causes them to tend toward the light side, though there are exceptions.

Name: Expressive
Text: You have proficiency in your choice of artist's implements, disguise kits, synthweaver's implements, or one musical instrument of your choice.

Name: Languages
Text: You can speak, read, and write Galactic Basic and one extra language of your choice.

Name: Mutation
Text: Theelin gain unique mutations, a result of cross-breeding with other humanoids. Choose one of the following mutations.

Name: Performer
Text: You have proficiency in the Performance skill.

Name: Size
Text: Theelin typically stand 5 to 6 feet tall and generally weigh about 140 lbs. Regardless of your position in that range, your size is Medium.

Name: Skill Versatility
Text: You gain proficiency in one skill of your choice.

Name: Speed
Text: Your base walking speed is 30 feet.

Name: Ability Score Increase
Text: Your Wisdom score increases by 2, and your Strength score increases by 1.

Name: Age
Text: Thisspiasians reach adulthood in their 20s and often live more than a century.

Name: Alignment
Text: Thisspiasians' emotional composure causes them to tend toward lawful alignments, though there are exceptions.

Name: Claws
Text: Your claws are a natural weapon, which you can use to make unarmed strikes. Additionally, your unarmed strikes deal 1d4 kinetic damage.

Name: Cultured
Text: You have proficiency in the Lore skill.

Name: Four-Armed
Text: Thisspiasians have four arms which they can use independently of one another. You can only gain the benefit of items held by two of your arms at any given time, and once per round you can switch which arms you are benefiting from (no action required).

Name: Inscrutable
Text: Your calm demeanor and control make you hard to read. Wisdom (Insight) checks made against you have disadvantage, and you have advantage on any saving throw against an effect that would read your thoughts.

Name: Languages
Text: You can speak, read, and write Galactic Basic and Thisspiasian. Thisspiasian is a complex language characterized by its interlocking sentences and heavy use of sibilants.

Name: Prehensile Tail
Text: You have supreme control over your tail and can use it to manipulate objects as well as your hands.

Name: Size
Text: Thisspiasians typically stand 5 to 6 and a half feet tall and generally weigh about 300 lbs. Regardless of your position in that range, your size is Medium.

Name: Speed
Text: Your base walking speed is 30 feet.

Name: Trance
Text: You only need 3 hours of sleep during a long rest to gain its benefits, instead of 6. Additionally, if your long rest would be interrupted, you only need to complete the long rest instead of restarting it to gain its benefits.

Name: Ability Score Increase
Text: Your Dexterity score increases by 2, and your Strength, Intelligence, or Charisma score increases by 1.

Name: Age
Text: Tiss'shar reach adulthood in their early teens and live about 80 years.

Name: Alignment
Text: Tiss'shar's moral flexibility causes them to tend towards balanced alignments, though there are exceptions.

Name: Darkvision
Text: Your vision can easily cut through darkness. You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can�t discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

Name: Languages
Text: You can speak, read, and write Galactic Basic and Tiss'shar. Tiss'shar is mainly formed of hisses, shrieks, and lisping vocalizations. As a written language, it has a violent-looking calligraphy of curves and sharp lines.

Name: Predatory Talents
Text: You have proficiency in one of the following skills: Acrobatics, Sleight of Hand, Stealth, or Technology.

Name: Size
Text: Tiss'shar typically stand 5 to 6 feet tall and generally weigh about 140 lbs. Regardless of your position in that range, your size is Medium.

Name: Speed
Text: Your base walking speed is 30 feet.

Name: Surprise Attack
Text: If you surprise a creature and hit it with an attack on your first turn in combat, the attack deals an extra 2d6 damage to it. You can use this trait only once per combat.

Name: Tooth and Nail
Text: Your sharp teeth and claws are natural weapons, which you can use to make unarmed strikes. Additionally, your unarmed strikes deal 1d6 kinetic damage. Lastly, as a bonus action, you can perform a special bite attack. On a hit, the target suffers the attack's normal effects, you gain temporary hit points equal to your Constitution modifier (minimum of 1), and you can't use this trait again until you finish a short or long rest.

Name: Ability Score Increase
Text: Your Strength, Dexterity, and Constitution scores increase by 1.

Name: Age
Text: Tognath reach adulthood by 10 and live less than a century.

Name: Alignment
Text: Tognath are famously dedicated and hard workers, causing them to tend towards balanced alignments, though there are exceptions.

Name: Crafters
Text: You have proficiency with one set of artisan's implements of your choice.

Name: Exoskeleton
Text: You have a thick exoskeleton. While you are unarmored or wearing light armor, your AC is 13 + your Dexterity modifier.

Name: Foreign Biology
Text: You cannot breathe oxygen. The tognath have created a breathing apparatus to negate the negative effects of living in an oxygen rich environment, but if your mask is removed while you are in such an environment, you lose consciousness.

Name: Languages
Text: You can speak, read, and write Tognath. You can understand spoken and written Galactic Basic, but your vocal cords do not allow you to speak it.

Name: Life in the Void
Text: You have resistance to necrotic damage, and while exposed to the vacuum of space, you can survive for a number of hours equal to your Constitution modifier (minimum 1 hour), instead of a number of rounds.

Name: Primitive Nerves
Text: Because of their primitive nervous systems, tognath are immune to most pain, letting them shrug off major injuries. When you take damage, you can use your reaction to roll a d12. Add your Constitution modifier to the number rolled, and reduce the damage by that total. Once you've used this trait, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

Name: Size
Text: Tognath typically stand 6 feet tall and generally weigh about 140 lbs. Regardless of your position in that range, your size is Medium.

Name: Speed
Text: Your base walking speed is 30 feet.

Name: Vocalizer
Text: Tognath vocal cords are not made for oxygen rich environments, and rely on a vocalizer to communicate effectively with other species. If your vocalizer is removed or destroyed, your voice becomes quiet and difficult to understand.

Name: Ability Score Increase
Text: Your Strength score increases by 2, and your Dexterity or Constitution score increases by 1.

Name: Age
Text: Togorian reach adulthood in their late teens and live less than a century.

Name: Alignment
Text: Togorians' rigid sense of honor causes them to tend toward lawful light side, though there are exceptions.

Name: Claws
Text: Your claws are a natural weapon, which you can use to make unarmed strikes. Additionally, your unarmed strikes deal 1d6 kinetic damage.

Name: Languages
Text: You can speak, read, and write Galactic Basic and Togorese. Togorese is characterized by its deep, resonating growls.

Name: Savage Attacks
Text: When you score a critical hit with a melee weapon attack, you can roll one of the weapon's damage dice one additional time and add it to the extra damage of the critical hit.

Name: Size
Text: Togorians tower over almost all other species, with smaller females standing upwards of 7 feet tall and weighing 250 lbs., while males can easily reach 8 feet tall and weigh around 350 lbs. Regardless of your position in that range, your size is Medium.

Name: Speed
Text: Your base walking speed is 30 feet.

Name: Stealthy Hunter
Text: You have proficiency in the Survival and Stealth skills.

Name: Toughness
Text: Your hit point maximum increases by 1, and it increases by 1 every time you gain a level.

Name: Ability Score Increase
Text: Your Charisma score increases by 2, and your Intelligence score increases by 1.

Name: Age
Text: Toydarians reach adulthood at 10 and live less than a century.

Name: Alignment
Text: Toydarians' greedy nature causes them to tend toward chaotic balanced, though there are exceptions.

Name: Business Savvy
Text: A common trait of all Toydarians is their shrewd business sense and their ability to haggle any deal. A loyal and proud people, these traits could be off-putting to outsiders, as many Toydarians in the galaxy were seen as crooks or slimy businessmen, but this was not always the case. Whenever you make a Charisma (Persuasion) check involving haggling you are considered to have expertise in the Persuasion skill.

Name: Closed Mind
Text: Toydarian brains have an unusual composition which made them resistant to influence from the Force. You have advantage on Wisdom and Charisma saving throws against force powers.

Name: Flight
Text: You have a flying speed equal to your walking speed. While wearing medium or heavy armor, your flying speed is reduced by half.

Name: Languages
Text: You can speak, read, and write Galactic Basic, Huttese, and Toydarian.

Name: Shrewd Demeanor
Text: You have proficiency in two Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma skills of your choice.

Name: Size
Text: Toydarians average 4 feet tall and weigh less than 50 lbs. Regardless of your position in that range, your size is Small.

Name: Speed
Text: Your base walking speed is 25 feet.

Name: Undersized
Text: Your small stature makes it hard for you to wield bigger weapons. You can't use heavy shields. Additionally, you can't use martial weapons with the two-handed property unless it also has the light property, and if a martial weapon has the versatile property, you can only wield it in two hands.

Name: Ability Score Increase
Text: Your Intelligence score increases by 2, and your Strength score increases by 1.

Name: Age
Text: Ugnaughts reach adulthood at 20 and can live to reach 200.

Name: Alignment
Text: Ugnaughts tend toward no particular alignment. The best and worst are found among them.

Name: Bite
Text: Your tusks are a natural weapon, which you can use to make unarmed strikes. Additionally, your unarmed strikes deal 1d6 kinetic damage.

Name: Crafters
Text: You have proficiency in one tool of your choice.

Name: Darkvision
Text: You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

Name: Industrial Hazards
Text: You have resistance to acid damage.

Name: Languages
Text: You can speak, read, and write Galactic Basic and Ugnaught. The Ugnaught language is composed of grunts, squeals, and chatters, and is difficult for other species to learn.

Name: Size
Text: Ugnaughts typically stand around 4 feet and weigh about 50 lbs. Regardless of your position in that range, your size is Small.

Name: Speed
Text: Your base walking speed is 25.

Name: Tech Dabbler
Text: You know the *mending* at-will tech power. When you reach 3rd level, you learn and can cast the *analyze* tech power once per day. When you reach 5th level, you learn and can cast the *overheat* tech power once per day. Your techcasting ability is Intelligence. You do not require use of a wristpad for these powers.

Name: Tinker
Text: You have proficiency with tinker's implements. You can use these and spend 1 hour and 100 cr worth of materials to construct a Tiny Device (AC 5, 1 hp). You can take the Use an Object action to have your device cause one of the following effects: create a small explosion, create a repeating loud noise for 1 minute, create smoke for 1 minute, cause harmless tremors for 1 minute. You can maintain a number of these devices up to your proficiency bonus at once, and a device stops functioning after 24 hours away from you. You can dismantle the device to reclaim the materials used to create it.

Name: Undersized
Text: Your small stature makes it hard for you to wield bigger weapons. You can't use heavy shields. Additionally, you can't use martial weapons with the two-handed property unless it also has the light property, and if a martial weapon has the versatile property, you can only wield it in two hands.

Name: Ability Score Increase
Text: Your Constitution score increases by 2, and your Intelligence score increases by 1.

Name: Age
Text: Ugors reach adulthood in their early teens and live about 70 years, though some live to be over 100.

Name: Alignment
Text: Ugors are loyal to their theocratic state and see outsiders as expendable. Many follow a Lawful Balanced alignment, though there are exceptions.

Name: Amorphous Form
Text: You can squeeze through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide, provided you are wearing and carrying nothing. You also have advantage on ability checks you make to initiate or escape a grapple.

Name: Darkvision
Text: You have a keen eyesight, especially in the dark. You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can�t discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

Name: Galactic Scavengers
Text: You have proficiency in mechanic's kits or scavenging kits (your choice).

Name: Languages
Text: You can speak, read and write in Galactic Basic and Ugor. Additionally, Your vocal range allows you to speak languages other species might have difficulty with.

Name: Natural Resilience
Text: You have resistance to poison damage, and you have advantage on saving throws against poison.

Name: Shape Self
Text: If you are not incapacitated, you can reshape your body to give yourself a head, one or two arms, one or two legs, and makeshift hands and feet, or you can revert to a limbless blob (no action required). As a bonus action, you can extrude a pseudopod that is up to 6 inches wide and 10 feet long or reabsorb it into your body. You can use this pseudopod to manipulate an object, open an unlocked door or container, stow or retrieve an item from an open container, or pour out the contents of a container. The pseudopod can�t attack, activate enhanced items, or carry more than 10 pounds.

Name: Size
Text: Ugors typically stand between 5 and 6 feet tall and weigh 130 lbs. Regardless of your position in that range, your size is Medium.

Name: Speed
Text: Your base walking speed is 25 feet.

Name: Ability Score Increase
Text: Your Intelligence score increases by 2, and your Charisma or Wisdom score increases by 1.

Name: Age
Text: Umbarans reach adulthood in their late teens and live less than a century.

Name: Alignment
Text: Umbarans' desire to improve their social standing at all costs causes them to tend towards chaos, though there are exceptions

Name: Languages
Text: You can speak, read, and write Galactic Basic and Umbaran. Umbaran is characterized by its blending of technical jargon with informal language. It is rarely spoken off Umbara.

Name: Shadow People
Text: You can attempt to hide even when you are only lightly obscured by dim light.

Name: Size
Text: Umbarans typically stand 5 to 6 feet tall and generally weigh about 140 lbs. Regardless of your position in that range, your size is Medium.

Name: Speed
Text: Your base walking speed is 30 feet.

Name: Sunlight Sensitivity
Text: You have disadvantage on attack rolls and on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight when you, the target of your attack, or whatever you are trying to perceive is in direct sunlight.

Name: Superior Darkvision
Text: You've lived most of your life without direct sunlight. You can see in dim light within 120 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

Name: Tech Dabbler
Text: You know the *ward* at-will tech power. When you reach 3rd level, you learn and can cast the *analyze* tech power once per day. When you reach 5th level, you can also cast the *infiltrate* tech power once per day. Intelligence is your techcasting ability for these powers. You do not require use of a wristpad for these powers.

Name: Umbaran Specilization
Text: You have proficiency in one of the following skills: Insight, Technology, Deception, or Perception.

Name: Ability Score Increase
Text: Your Intelligence score increases by 2, and your Constitution score increases by 1.

Name: Age
Text: Verpine reach adulthood in their 40's and live an average of 200 years.

Name: Alignment
Text: Verpine's altruistic and generous nature cause them to tend toward the light side, though there are exceptions.

Name: Crafters
Text: You have proficiency in one tool of your choice.

Name: Hardened Carapace
Text: While you are unarmored or wearing light armor, your AC is 13 + your Dexterity modifier.

Name: Languages
Text: You can speak, read, and write Verpine. You can understand spoken and written Galactic Basic, but your vocal cords do not allow you to speak it. You can communicate with other Verpine at distances of up to a mile using your antennae.

Name: Size
Text: Verpine stand between 6 and 7 feet tall and rarely weigh more than 120 lbs. Regardless of your position in that range, your size is Medium.

Name: Speed
Text: Your base walking speed is 30 feet.

Name: Tympanic Antennae
Text: You have tremorsense out to 30 feet. You can detect and pinpoint the origin of vibrations within that radius, provided that monster and the source of the vibrations are in contact with the same ground or substance. Tremorsense can't be used to detect flying or incorporeal creatures

Name: Ability Score Increase
Text: Your Wisdom score increases by 2, and your Constitution score increases by 1.

Name: Age
Text: Voss reach adulthood in their late teens and live less than a century. They do not reach sexual maturity until they undergo the Rite of Ardor.

Name: Alignment
Text: As Voss culture encourages duty and emotional composure, individuals tend toward a lawful alignment, though there are exceptions.

Name: Darkvision
Text: You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of grey.

Name: Inscrutable
Text: Your calm demeanor and control make you hard to read. Wisdom (Insight) checks made against you have disadvantage, and you have advantage on any saving throw against an effect that would read your thoughts.

Name: Languages
Text: You can speak, read, and write Galactic Basic and Voss. The Voss language is characterized by it's mystic-sounding word pairings.

Name: Mystic Healing
Text: You have proficiency in Medicine.

Name: Precognition
Text: You see brief visions of the future, that allow you to turn failures into successes. When you roll a 1 on an attack roll, ability check, or saving throw, you can reroll the die and must use the new roll.

Name: Size
Text: Voss typically stand 5 to 6 feet tall and generally weigh about 150 lbs. Regardless of your position in that range, your size is Medium.

Name: Speed
Text: Your base walking speed is 30 feet.

Name: Voss Weapon Training
Text: You have proficiency with the blaster rifle and techblade.

Name: Ability Score Increase
Text: Your Wisdom score increases by 2, and your Constitution score increases by 1.

Name: Age
Text: Vurk reach adulthood in their 20s and live an average of 70 years.

Name: Alignment
Text: Vurk philosophies cause them to tend toward the light side, though there are exceptions.

Name: Amphibious
Text: You can breathe air and water.

Name: Athletic
Text: You have proficiency in the Athletics skill.

Name: Darkvision
Text: Accustomed to life underwater, you have superior vision in low light conditions. You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

Name: Head Crest
Text: Your head crest is a natural weapon, which you can use to make unarmed strikes. Additionally, your unarmed strikes deal 1d6 kinetic damage.

Name: Languages
Text: You can speak, read, and write Galactic Basic and Semblan. Semblan has a very melodic feel and often evokes images of waterfalls to those who don't understand its meanings.

Name: Size
Text: Vurks typically stand between 6 and 7 feet tall and weigh around 175 lbs. Regardless of your position in that range, your size is Medium.

Name: Speed
Text: Your base walking speed is 35 feet.

Name: Swim
Text: You have a swimming speed of 30 feet.

Name: Ability Score Increase
Text: Your Dexterity score increases by 2, and your Wisdom score increases by 1.

Name: Age
Text: Xexto reach adulthood at 9 and live less than a century.

Name: Alignment
Text: Despite being avid thrillseekers, xexto are calm and even tempered, tending them towards balanced alignments, though there are exceptions.

Name: Dexterous
Text: You have proficiency in one of the following skills: Acrobatics, Piloting, or Sleight of Hand.

Name: Fearless
Text: You have advantage on saving throws against being frightened.

Name: Four-Armed
Text: Xexto have four arms which they can use independently of one another. You can only gain the benefit of items held by two of your arms at any given time, and once per round you can switch which arms you are benefiting from (no action required).

Name: Jungle Dweller
Text: Growing up in the rainforests of Troiken has left an impact. You don�t treat jungle terrain as difficult terrain.

Name: Languages
Text: You can speak, read, and write Galactic Basic and Xextese. Xextese is a blubbering sort of language, with many metaphors for natural phenomenon found in its vocabulary.

Name: Racer's Reflexes
Text: Whenever you make a Dexterity ability check, attack roll, or saving throw, you can choose to add 1d4 to the result. You cannot do so again until you complete a short or long rest.

Name: Size
Text: Xexto typically stand 3 to 5 feet tall and generally weigh about 50 lbs. Regardless of your position in that range, your size is Small.

Name: Speed
Text: Your base walking speed is 25 feet.

Name: Split Mind
Text: When you make a Wisdom saving throw, you can use your reaction to gain advantage on the roll. Once you've done so, you must complete a short or long rest before you can do so again.

Name: Treeclimber
Text: You have a climbing speed equal to your walking speed. You have advantage on Strength ability checks and saving throws that involve climbing.

Name: Undersized
Text: Your small stature makes it hard for you to wield bigger weapons. You can�t use heavy shields. Additionally, you can�t use martial weapons with the two-handed property unless it also has the light property, and if a martial weapon has the versatile property, you can only wield it in two hands.

Name: Ability Score Increase
Text: Your Strength score increases by 2, and your Intelligence score increases by 1.

Name: Age
Text: Yevetha reach adulthood in their early teens and live less than a century.

Name: Aggressive
Text: As a bonus action, you can move up to your speed toward an enemy of your choice that you can see or hear. You must end this move closer to the enemy than you started.

Name: Alignment
Text: Yevetha's xenophobic attitude causes them to tend toward the dark side, though there are exceptions.

Name: Arm Blades
Text: Your retractable dewclaws are natural weapons, which you can use to make unarmed strikes. Additionally, your unarmed strikes deal 1d6 kinetic damage.

Name: Languages
Text: You can speak, read, and write Galactic Basic and Yevethan. Yevetha are able to speak other languages, but their isolationist nature makes them tend to reject the languages of other species. Only rarely would a Yevethan speak Galactic Basic, as this would often decrease their social standing.

Name: Mechanical Memory
Text: Whenever you make an Intelligence (Technology) check related to memorizing or duplicating mechanical readouts, you are considered to have expertise in the Technology skill.

Name: Size
Text: Yevetha typically stand between 6 and 6 and a half feet tall and generally weigh about 160 lbs. Regardless of your position in that range, your size is Medium.

Name: Speed
Text: Your base walking speed is 30 feet.

Name: Toughness
Text: Your hit point maximum increases by 1, and it increases by 1 every time you gain a level.

Name: Ability Score Increase
Text: Your Charisma score increases by 2, and your Constitution score increases by 1.

Name: Age
Text: Zeltron reach adulthood in their late teens and live about 80 years.

Name: Alignment
Text: Zeltron are a deeply sensual, hedonistic species, causing them to tend toward chaotic balanced or dark side alignments, though there are exceptions.

Name: Charismatic
Text: You have proficiency with Deception or Persuasion (your choice).

Name: Enthralling Pheromones
Text: You can use your pheromones to influence individuals of both sexes. Whenever you roll a 1 on a Charisma (Persuasion) check, you can reroll the die and must use the new roll. Additionally, once per short or long rest, you can treat a d20 roll of 9 or lower on a Charisma check as a 10. This feature has no effect on droids or constructs.

Name: Languages
Text: You can speak, read, and write Galactic Basic and one language of your choice.

Name: Natural Empathy
Text: Zeltron's limited telepathy allow them to sense mood shifts in those around them. You have advantage on Wisdom (Insight) checks to determine emotions against humanoids and beasts within 10 feet of you.

Name: Size
Text: Zeltron tend to be slender and statuesque, typically standing between 5 and 6 feet tall and rarely weighing more than 150 lb. Regardless of your position in that range, your size is Medium.

Name: Speed
Text: Your base walking speed is 30 feet.

Name: Two Livered
Text: Zeltron have two livers, which makes them adept at filtering toxins. You have advantage on saving throws against poison, and you have resistance against poison damage (explained in chapter 9).

Name: Ability Score Increase
Text: Your Dexterity score increases by 2, and two other ability scores of your choice increase by 1.

Name: Age
Text: Zilkin are considered adults at 4 years old, and rarely live to be over 12.

Name: Alignment
Text: Zilkin have an outspoken but just nature that causes them to tend towards lawful light side, though there are exceptions.

Name: Amphibious
Text: You can breathe air and water.

Name: Darkvision
Text: Accustomed to life underwater, you have superior vision in low light conditions. You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

Name: Languages
Text: You can speak, read, and write Galactic Basic and Zilkin. Zilkin is characterized by loud, croaking noises from the throat, supported by air stored in the chin.

Name: Pintsized
Text: Your tiny stature makes it hard for you to wield bigger weapons. You can't use medium or heavy shields. Additionally, you can't wield weapons with the two-handed or versatile property, and you can only wield one-handed weapons in two hands unless they have the light property.

Name: Puny
Text: Zilkin are too small to pack much of a punch. You have disadvantage on Strength saving throws, and when determining your bonus to attack and damage rolls for weapon attacks using Strength, you can't add more than +3.

Name: Quick Learner
Text: When using downtime for learning a new language or training with a set of tools, it takes half the amount of time and credits necessary to complete.

Name: Size
Text: Zilkin stand between 1 and 2 feet tall and weigh around 10 lbs. Regardless of your position in that range, your size is Tiny.

Name: Small and Nimble
Text: You are too small and fast to effectively target. You have a +1 bonus to AC, and you have advantage on Dexterity saving throws.

Name: Speed
Text: Your base walking speed is 20 feet.

Name: Strong-Legged
Text: When you make a long jump, you can cover a number of feet up to twice your Strength score. When you make a high jump, you can leap a number of feet up into the air equal to 3 + twice your Strength modifier.

Name: Swim
Text: You have a swimming speed of 20 feet.

Name: Ability Score Increase
Text: Your Charisma score increases by 2, and your Intelligence score increases by 1.

Name: Acrobatic
Text: You have proficiency in Acrobatics.

Name: Age
Text: Zygerrians reach adulthood in their late teens and live less than a century.

Name: Alignment
Text: Zygerrian culture's emphasis on subjugation and strength causes them to tend towards chaotic dark side, though there are exceptions.

Name: Claws
Text: Your unarmed strikes deal 1d4 kinetic damage and have the finesse property.

Name: Darkvision
Text: You have a cat's keen senses, especially in the dark. You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

Name: Languages
Text: You can speak, read, and write Galactic Basic and Zygerrian. Zygerrian is characterized by its subtle growls and purrs.

Name: Notorious Slavers
Text: Whenever you make an ability check related to the buying, selling, or controlling of slaves, you are considered proficient in the check. If you would already be proficient, you instead have expertise.

Name: Reputation for Cruelty
Text: You are proficient in Intimidation, as well as the saberwhip and vibrowhip.

Name: Size
Text: Zygerrians normally stand between 5 to 6 feet tall and weigh about 140 lbs. Regardless of your position in that range, your size is Medium.

Name: Speed
Text: Your base walking speed is 30 feet.
